keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
keywords.name: organizations

byline.original: By RICK GLADSTONE and HWAIDA SAAD
byline.contributor: Rick Gladstone reported from New York, and Hwaida Saad from Beirut, Lebanon.

lead_paragraph: Islamic State fighters were reported to have booby-trapped Palmyra’s archaeological treasures before retreating.

headline.print_headline: ISIS Fighters Laid Mines Around Palmyra’s Ancient Ruins Before Retreating, Syrians Say
headline.main: ISIS Fighters Laid Mines Around Palmyra’s Ancient Ruins Before Retreating, Syrians Say

snippet: Islamic State fighters were reported to have booby-trapped Palmyra’s archaeological treasures before retreating.
abstract: Syrian forces report that Islamic State militants laid dozens of mines around ancient ruins in Palmyra before retreat; Russia has committed 100 mine clearance engineers along with bomb-sniffing dogs to remove mines.
